oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Blanket
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A civilian blanket that has been stencil painted with crossed rifles having "41" above and "H" over "18" below. This is intrepreted as 18th soldier, Company H, 41st Infantry. The 41st Infantry Regiment was formed in June 1917 at Fort Snelling, Minnesota, and was assigned to the 10th Division at Camp Funston, Kansas, commanded by Leonard Wood. In Oct. 1918, the regiment sent an advanced party to France, but the War ended in Nov. so the whole regiment was not deployed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
